value.name: The Second Amendment’s anti-Blackness
value.description: In her new book, a historian uncovers how racist denials of Black people’s gun rights threaten both their safety and citizenship.

mentions.name: Second Amendment to the United States Constitution

value.name: The Second Amendment is not about guns -- it's about anti-Blackness, a new book argues
value.description: By John Blake, CNN One of Charlton Heston's greatest performances came not in a Hollywood film but on a convention stage where he electrified a crowd of gun-rights enthusiasts.

value.name: Minnesota briefs: Small-town mayor arrested, charged with DWI at 97 mph
value.description: Mc­Broom Sr. was clocked by a state trooper at 97 mph in a 60 mph zone, according to a summons and complaint filed last week in Le Sueur County District Court. When he was questioned, Mc­Broom denied drinking any alcohol and said he was speeding because he badly had to go to the bathroom.

value.name: DON'T MISS: Carol Anderson
value.description: The message, Anderson writes, is loud and clear: "Even for the NRA, Black people did not have Second Amendment rights." EVENT: Carol Anderson will present "The Second" in a virtual event at 7 p.m. June 3,

value.name: Athletes Will Never Be Quiet Again
value.description: And while sports activism long predates Floyd’s death, the event imbued athletes and coaches with a new sense of purpose that remains strong a year later—and not just in pro basketball. In an uncharacteristically bold step,

value.name: A year after Floyd’s death, activists in Minneapolis seek end to ‘status quo’ racism
value.description: One year ago today, George Floyd's murder by former policeman Derek Chauvin in Minneapolis shocked the country, but those within the community, particularly Black residents, say it was inevitable. They point to a history of racist policies and political gridlock as reasons for the deaths of Black men like Floyd and Philando Castile.
